programme.title: Helck
programme.desc: Helck displays mind-blowing strength and leaves Vermilio concerned about the threat he poses.

programme.title: Helck
programme.desc: After Helck blocks an attack meant for Edil, Vermilio is convinced that he is an enemy; the floor gives away and everyone falls into a dark underground room.

programme.title: Helck
programme.desc: The mysterious power of the gate sends Vermilio and Helck to an unknown remote island; Vermilio travels deeper into the island and comes across a fluffy creature.

programme.title: Helck
programme.desc: Vermilio poses a question to Helck; the others at Castle Urum are fighting an overwhelming number of winged knights.

programme.title: Helck
programme.desc: Hyura and the others escape Castle Urum, but soon find themselves surrounded again; Azudra arrives to subdue the winged knights; Azudra begins plotting.

programme.title: Helck
programme.desc: Azudra determines the winged knights are a major threat; Helck and Vermilio take it easy.

programme.title: Helck
programme.desc: Helck and Vermilio bid farewell to the mysterious island and its residents as they sail away with a stowaway Piwi aboard; they run into a massive whirlpool.

programme.title: Helck
programme.desc: Helck and company end up in the Erille Kingdom where they must fight the barbarians of the Tothman Tribe; the Tothman King goes berserk after tapping into a mysterious power.

programme.title: Helck
programme.desc: Helck and company use their winnings from the cooking competition to buy a map leading to the Empire; they make plans to go northwest into the ruins of two destroyed kingdoms.

programme.title: Helck
programme.desc: Vermilio is frightened by Helck's power as he goes berserk during his battle with Augis; it makes her recall the words of the Great Witch who warned her about Helck.

programme.title: Helck
programme.desc: Helck and his younger brother Cless lose both of their parents at a young age; Cless gets very sick and Helck begs for someone to save him.

programme.title: Helck
programme.desc: Monsters begin to appear in greater numbers after Cless departs on his expedition; the kingdom enacts a military draft to combat them.

programme.title: Helck
programme.desc: Helck arrives at the Demon Lord's castle and senses a powerful presence; it turns out to be Azudra of the Four Elite Lords, who makes a plea for peace.

programme.title: Helck
programme.desc: Zeruzeon reveals the kingdom's terrifying plan, so Helck and his friends sneak into the castle to stop it by saving Cless.

programme.title: Helck
programme.desc: Helck is on the verge of being killed; to save the life of his big brother, Cless is forced to make a choice.

programme.title: Helck
programme.desc: Helck charges onward but an army of bounty hunters stands between him and Alicia; she is in horrible shape as she faces public execution.

programme.title: Helck

programme.title: Helck
programme.desc: The winged knights continue attacking Castle Thor to level themselves up further; Asta keeps snooping for information in the human realm.

programme.title: Helck

programme.title: Helck
programme.desc: Hyura and Edil battle it out at Castle Thor while a strange relationship starts between them; Azudra confronts Mikaros and reveals a past grudge.

programme.title: Helck
programme.desc: Raphaeds army attacks a demonkin outpost, when Helck and Vermilio arrive; Raphaed determines Vermilio is Helcks newfound source of support.

programme.title: Helck
programme.desc: Helck faces off with his former friend, Alicia; Vermilio can't help but be concerned about Helck as she continues to fight with Raphaed.

programme.title: Moribito: Guardian of the Spirit
programme.desc: Balsa returns to Shin Yogo after two years, but her plans to repair her spear are derailed when a procession for the royal family goes suspiciously awry.

programme.title: Moribito: Guardian of the Spirit
programme.desc: Balsa makes preparations for the upcoming journey with the help of some old friends before they escape the city.

programme.title: Moribito: Guardian of the Spirit
programme.desc: Balsa must rely on Chagum to save them after she is wounded in her battle with the Hunters.

programme.title: Moribito: Guardian of the Spirit
programme.desc: Balsa's childhood friend helps her recover from her injuries; a strange letter is sent to the Star Palace.

programme.title: Moribito: Guardian of the Spirit
programme.desc: A funeral for the supposedly deceased prince disguises a manhunt for Balsa and Chagum; Balsa hatches an unorthodox plan to throw off their scent.

programme.title: Moribito: Guardian of the Spirit

programme.desc: Chagum and Balsa set off for the mountains with a fresh look, but operatives of the emperor relentlessly dog their footsteps.

programme.desc: Chagum is presented with unexpected challenges as they settle into their new home.

programme.title: Moribito: Guardian of the Spirit
programme.desc: Balsa attempts to have her spear repaired but the blacksmith she contracts to perform the work needs some convincing before he mends the blade.

programme.title: Moribito: Guardian of the Spirit
programme.desc: The drought sign has not faded and Shuga fears the fate of the kingdom is at stake; in Shuga's pursuit of the truth, the crown prince Sagum's loyalty is put to test.

programme.desc: Chagum learns about life outside the palace; Balsa's friend Toya shows him the ropes in the big city.

programme.title: Moribito: Guardian of the Spirit
programme.desc: Saya collapses unexpectedly, but this is more than a simple case of fatigue; it takes every ounce of Tanda's skill to bring her back to the world of the living.

programme.title: Moribito: Guardian of the Spirit
programme.desc: A boy named Yarsam gets under Chagum's skin during the Summer Solstice Festival; Chagum fights him in the lucha ring.

programme.title: Moribito: Guardian of the Spirit
programme.desc: A figure from Balsa's past lurks in the shadows, hungry for revenge and intent on disrupting her new life with Chagum.

programme.desc: Torogai's dangerous foray into the spirit world yields important information about Chagum and the egg of the water spirit.

programme.title: Moribito: Guardian of the Spirit
programme.desc: Shuga unearths important information about Chagum; he has to decide whether to share this information with the crown prince, Sagum.

programme.desc: Shuga's search for the truth continues; Zen and Mon are in pursuit with deadly orders from the head star reader.

programme.title: Moribito: Guardian of the Spirit
programme.desc: Chagum encounters a figure from his old life who comes bearing important news; Balsa will not let Chagum go.

programme.title: Moribito: Guardian of the Spirit
programme.desc: Balsa escorts Chagum, Tanda, and Torogai to Tomi village to learn more about the egg of the water spirit; their learning causes unrest instead of comfort.

programme.title: Moribito: Guardian of the Spirit
programme.desc: While Balsa, Tanda, and Torogai discuss how to save him, Chagum runs away to seek protection from the palace.

programme.title: Moribito: Guardian of the Spirit
programme.desc: An unexpected alliance emerges between Torogai and Shuga; Balsa, Tonda, and Chagum settle into a cave called Hunter's Hole to wait out the winter.

programme.title: Moribito: Guardian of the Spirit
programme.desc: Balsa tells Chagum about her childhood in the kingdom of Kanbal and the spear-wielding man named Jiguro Musa, who saved her life.

programme.title: Moribito: Guardian of the Spirit
programme.desc: Balsa's savior inspires her and she takes an oath to balance the scales of life and death; Chagum is inspired by Balsa and asks to be trained in the way of the spear.

programme.title: Moribito: Guardian of the Spirit
programme.desc: Winter has thawed at last, spring flowers breaking through the frost; Balsa and Chagum leave Hunter's Hole and travel toward Aoike Pond, but trouble lurks not far behind.

programme.title: Moribito: Guardian of the Spirit
programme.desc: When Egg Eater closes in on Chagum, a message from Gakai to Shuga provides a little clarity regarding the Place of Celebration, but the information arrives too late.

programme.title: Moribito: Guardian of the Spirit
programme.desc: With the secret to defeating the Egg Eaters in tow, Balsa pursues Chagum to the true Place of Celebration; at the place where worlds intersect, they make their final stand.

programme.title: Moribito: Guardian of the Spirit
programme.desc: Chagum is named Crown Prince and Divine Hero of the People; as he reunites with his mother, Balsa contemplates the future.

programme.title: Outbreak Company
programme.desc: A lowly otaku is transported to a magic kingdom to bring his nerdy hobbies to the populace in a cultural exchange program.
